meanings.definition: The ventral plate of an arthropod segment.
meanings.sent1: The sternite of the insect helps protect its belly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the sternite to learn more about arthropods.
meanings.sent3: The sternite of the beetle was so shiny, it looked like a mirror!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a sternite, always shielding others from harm.
meanings.sent5: The sternite, like a shield, guards the vulnerable underside of the arthropod.

meanings.definition: The ventral part of a segment of an arthropod body.
meanings.sent1: The sternite of the spider is where its legs attach.
meanings.sent2: Careful observation of the sternite can reveal important details about the arthropod.
meanings.sent3: The sternite of the ant looked like a tiny stage for a play!
meanings.sent4: His sternite was a fortress, protecting his innermost thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The sternite, like a secret chamber, holds the mysteries of the arthropod's body.

meanings.definition: The ventral sclerite of an arthropod segment.
meanings.sent1: The sternite of the beetle was hard and shiny.
meanings.sent2: Examining the sternite under a microscope can reveal intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The sternite of the grasshopper looked like a tiny shield!
meanings.sent4: Her sternite was a fortress, protecting her fragile heart.
meanings.sent5: The sternite, like a precious gem, gleamed under the sunlight.
